items: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a dumbbell in each hand with your palms facing your body.
Bend your knees slightly and hinge forward at the hips, keeping your back straight and your core engaged.
Bring the dumbbells up towards your chest, keeping your elbows close to your body and squeezing your shoulder blades together.
Lower the dumbbells back down to the starting position, keeping your back straight and your core engaged.
Repeat for the desired number of reps.

content.title: Dumbbell Bent Over Row Form & Visual

items: Strengthens the back muscles, including the latissimus dorsi, rhomboids, and trapezius
Improves posture and reduces the risk of back pain
Targets the biceps and forearms as secondary muscles
Increases overall upper body strength and muscle mass
Can be modified for different fitness levels and goals by adjusting weight and reps

content.title: Dumbbell Bent Over Row Muscles Worked

items: Latissimus dorsi
Trapezius
Rhomboids
Erector spinae
Biceps brachii
Brachialis
Brachioradialis
